qas.question: On what computer was the first numerical weather forecast produced?
In what year did von Neumann publish the paper Numerical Integration of the Barotropic Vorticity Equation
How much colder was world in last glacial age?

context: Von Neumann's team performed the world's first numerical weather forecasts on the <a0_0>ENIAC<a0_0/> computer; von Neumann published the paper Numerical Integration of the Barotropic Vorticity Equation in <a1_0>1950<a1_0/>. Von Neumann's interest in weather systems and meteorological prediction led him to propose manipulating the environment by spreading colorants on the polar ice caps to enhance absorption of solar radiation (by reducing the albedo). thereby inducing global warming. Noting that the Earth was only <a2_0>6 °F (3.3 °C) colder<a2_0/> during the last glacial period, he noted that the burning of coal and oil "a general warming of the Earth by about one degree Fahrenheit."
